New Records: Rahmanullah Gurbaz and Ibrahim Zadran struck the second-highest opening stand in T20 World Cup history with a 154-run partnership.
Fazalhaq Farooqi took his maiden five-wicket haul in T20Is.
Key Match Events: Rahmanullah Gurbaz scored 76 off 45 balls with four sixes and as many fours.
Ibrahim Zadran scored 70 off 46 balls with nine fours and a six.
Fazalhaq Farooqi took 5 wickets for 9 runs.
Naveen-ul-Haq and Rashid Khan picked up two wickets each.
Afghanistan won by 125 runs, bowling out Uganda for 58 runs in 16 overs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Uganda made their debut in the T20 World Cup.
Afghanistan's 183 for 5 was too much for Uganda, who were bowled out for 58 runs in 16 overs.
Uganda's captain Brian Masaba and fast bowler Cosmas Kyewuta took two wickets each.
Uganda did not concede a single boundary in the last six overs of Afghanistan's innings, the first such instance in the T20 World Cup.
